pullrequest.title: Fixes to compile gazebo in the ARM platform

content.raw:
The POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE target property is only available on CMake 2.8.9 and above; anyone on a distribution using an older release in the 2.8 series (e.g. Ubuntu 12.04 with CMake 2.8.7) would probably get an error during CMake configuration.  As a result, the minimum version macro in the main CMakeLists.txt should be changed to say 2.8.9 instead of 2.8, or we need to find a better way to add -fPIC to the two static libs.  

The advantage of the POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE property is that it does the Right Thing on all platforms, whereas you'd need to be more careful just adding the -fPIC CFLAG to static library targets if for example Gazebo ever supported Windows.  The other alternative is to just quit making qtpropertybrowser and gazebo_gui_terrain as separate static libraries, and just lump them both into gazebo_gui.so (since that's effectively what's happening anyway) and therefore be rid of the whole mixing static/shared library linkage altogether.
